configs.author: cwtch.im
configs.name: Cwtch
configs.additionalSettings: {"intermediateLink":[],"customLinkFilterRegex":"","filterByLinkText":false,"skipSort":false,"reverseSort":false,"sortByLastLinkSegment":false,"versionExtractWholePage":false,"requestHeader":[{"requestHeader":"User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/114.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36"}],"defaultPseudoVersioningMethod":"partialAPKHash","trackOnly":false,"versionExtractionRegEx":"\\d+.\\d+.\\d+","matchGroupToUse":"","versionDetection":true,"useVersionCodeAsOSVersion":false,"apkFilterRegEx":"","invertAPKFilter":false,"autoApkFilterByArch":true,"appName":"","appAuthor":"","shizukuPretendToBeGooglePlay":false,"allowInsecure":false,"exemptFromBackgroundUpdates":false,"skipUpdateNotifications":false,"about":"","refreshBeforeDownload":false}

description.en: Cwtch is an MIT Licensed protocol based on Tor that aims to provide decentralized and peer-to-peer, privacy preserving, end-to-end encrypted communications that are metadata resistant. They've developed their own cross-platform, MIT Licensed client written in Flutter using their protocol.
